revision.comment: Reverted edits by [[Special:Contribs/168.216.133.89|168.216.133.89]] ([[User talk:168.216.133.89|talk]]) to last version by Monkbot
revision.text:
{{Expand list|date=February 2011}} {{cleanup |reason=The tables need better formatting and should be merged/combined with [[Timeline of time capsules]]. Also, many of the time capsules need sources.|date=June 2017}}
This is a '''list of [[time capsule]]s'''. The [[International Time Capsule Society]] estimates there are between 10,000 and 15,000 time capsules worldwide.<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.oglethorpe.edu/about_us/crypt_of_civilization/international_time_capsule_society.asp|title= Oglethorpe University - International Time Capsule Society|accessdate= 2008-07-01|url-status= dead|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20080620232510/http://www.oglethorpe.edu/about_us/crypt_of_civilization/international_time_capsule_society.asp|archivedate= 2008-06-20}}</ref>
== By country == === Australia === ==== Historical ==== On 29 September 1896, when the [[Perth Observatory]] foundation was laid, the occasion was attended by Sir [[John Forrest]] and other notable dignitaries. Several items of importance were placed in a 'leaden box', sealed and deposited in a cavity beneath the [[Cornerstone|foundation stone]]. The local press reported the event and mentioned here since "[[Röntgen rays]] tubes, and a description of the process, together with specimen photographs", donated by [[X-ray]] pioneer [[William John Hancock]] were included in the cache.<ref name="Editor. 1896 Page 2">Editor. (30 September 1896). The Perth Observatory. Laying the Foundation Stone. The West Australian. Perth. Western Australia. Page 2.</ref> This is the first known instance of a [[time capsule]] in [[Western Australia]], and in Australia.
Also in Western Australia, in celebration of the laying of the foundation stone of the Northam Railway Institute on 28 July 1897, laid by Mrs. Ann Throssell, the wife of the Commissioner of Crown Lands and local MP George Throssell, a bottle containing two copies of the ''Northam Advertiser'' newspaper and several coins was laid in a cavity beneath the foundation stone.<ref>The Northam Advertiser Saturday 31 July 1897 p 3</ref>
==== Contemporary ==== In celebration of its golden jubilee, Epping Boys High School of Sydney buried a time capsule in the foyer of its library, in 2007, to be unearthed in the centenary year. A previous time capsule was buried in 1982 to celebrate the silver jubilee. The town of Cowra in central Western New South Wales contained a time capsule which was buried near a sculpture of an eagle in the park not far from the town's information center. The capsule was opened in the year 2000 on an unspecified date, although the sculpture remains, there is no mention of the time capsule once buried there.
A time capsule is also located at Nailsworth Primary School in South Australia, being planted in 2001 to be opened in 2025, this capsule was planted to replace the 1977 capsule opened the same year.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://archiver.rootsweb.ancestry.com/th/read/AUS-SAGEN/2001-10/1004350483|title=RootsWeb: AUS-SAGEN-L [AUS-SAGEN] Reunions:Adelaide Advertiser- Sept/Oct 2001|author=|date=|website=archiver.rootsweb.ancestry.com}}</ref> A time capsule is also present on the grounds of Melbourne High school in Victoria.{{citation needed|date=September 2016}}
A time capsule on [[Canberra]]'s City Hill was unveiled on 11 March 2013 to commemorate the city's centenary. It is to be unsealed in 2113.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.abc.net.au/local/stories/2014/03/11/3961082.htm|title=Time capsule sealed inside Canberra's new Centenary Column|author=|date=11 March 2014|website=www.abc.net.au}}</ref>
On 22 February 2018, the Sunshine Coast Council concluded its celebration of the 50th Anniversary of the Naming of the Sunshine Coast by burying a historic time capsule.<ref name=":1">{{Cite news|url=https://www.sunshinecoast.qld.gov.au/Council/News-Centre/SC50-time-capsule-unveiled-today-for-future|title=SC50 time capsule unveiled today for future|work=Sunshine Coast Council|access-date=2018-03-16|language=en}}</ref> The capsule contains a number of reports, documents, and objects from the year previous, and a letter from Mayor Mark Jamieson and 2017 Young Citizen of the Year, Jak Hardy, who was appointed its guardian through to 2067.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.sunshinecoastdaily.com.au/news/sc50-time-capsule-unveiled-today-for-future/3343500/|title=SC50 time capsule unveiled today for future|work=Sunshine Coast Daily|access-date=2018-03-16|language=en}}</ref>
===Austria=== * [[Memory of Mankind]] in [[Hallstatt]].
=== Bermuda === In celebration of its 150th corporate anniversary, [[Bacardi]] Limited installed a 1.82m x 0.30m stainless steel time capsule, encased in a granite cap and cement pedestal, in front of the Bacardi worldwide headquarters in Bermuda. The capsule was placed in December 2012 and is intended to be opened in 2062, at the company's 200th anniversary.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.multivu.com/mnr/53414-bacardi-rum-150-anniversary-time-capsule-artifacts-birthday-celebration |title=Bacardi Celebrates Culmination Of Its Milestone 150th Anniversary With Time Capsule To Be Opened In 50 Years |date=2012-12-13 |accessdate=2013-03-29 |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130329174256/http://www.multivu.com/mnr/53414-bacardi-rum-150-anniversary-time-capsule-artifacts-birthday-celebration |archivedate=2013-03-29 |url-status=dead }}</ref>
=== Canada === *On July 26, 1830 a formal procession and ceremony took place to deposit coins and bottled newspapers into a carved hollow of the cornerstone of the new courthouse building at Harbor Grace, NL. Witnessed by more than 1000 residents and dignitaries, several symbolic items (corn, oil, wine) were poured over the stone.<ref>{{cite journal |last=Parsons |first=Alexander A. |title=A time honoured temple of justice: the old court house at Harbour Grace |url= |journal=The Cadet |volume=3 |issue=July |pages=9 |location=St. John's, NL |publisher=Catholic Cadet Corps |date=1916 }}</ref> The [http://www.historicplaces.ca/en/rep-reg/place-lieu.aspx?id=7537&pid=0/ Harbour Grace Court House] is the oldest surviving public building in Newfoundland and one of the [[National Historic Sites of Canada]]. * A geologist left a bottled message in 1959 in a [[cairn]] on [[Ward Hunt Island]] (83°N latitude), allowing its finders in 2013 to determine that a nearby glacier had retreated over 200 feet in 54 years.<ref name="LATimes20131220">{{cite news |last1=Mohan |first1=Geoffrey |title=Message in a bottle found 54 years later in Arctic |url=http://www.latimes.com/science/sciencenow/la-sci-sn-message-in-bottle-arctic-20131219-story.html |work=Los Angeles Times |date=20 December 2013 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140706145108/http://www.latimes.com/science/sciencenow/la-sci-sn-message-in-bottle-arctic-20131219-story.html |archivedate=6 July 2014 |url-status=live }}</ref> * Inside the head of the [[World's Largest Axe]] in [[Nackawic]], [[New Brunswick]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://nackawic.com/pdf/International_Garden_and_worlds_largest_axe.doc |title=World's Largest Axe |last=Melanson |first=Craig |date=2006-05-12 |website=Town of Nackawic |access-date=2017-09-05 |format=DOC |page=2}}</ref> * 6 Feet underground in the [[Chinook Centre]] in [[Calgary]], [[Alberta]]; to be opened on December 31, 2999.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.chinookcentre.com/en/centreinfo/Pages/FeaturesTimeCapsule.aspx |title=Time Capsule |website=Chinook Centre |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150321054716/http://www.chinookcentre.com/en/centreinfo/Pages/FeaturesTimeCapsule.aspx |archive-date=2015-03-21 |url-status=dead }}</ref> * 1234 Main Street, [[Moncton]], [[New Brunswick]]{{citation needed|date=September 2016}} * Inside [[Joseph Salter]] memorial, Main Street, [[Moncton]], [[New Brunswick]]{{citation needed|date=September 2016}} * Inside the [[CN Tower]], in [[Toronto]], [[Ontario]]. To be opened at the 100-year anniversary in 2076.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cntower.ca/en-ca/about-us/history/time-capsule.html|title=Time Capsule - CN Tower|website=CN Tower|publisher=CN Tower|accessdate=28 March 2018}}</ref>
===Chile=== * A privately funded time capsule, buried in front of the former city hall of [[Puerto Montt]] in October 2010, to be opened by February 2053. * The ''Cápsula Bicentenario'' (Bicentennial Capsule), a publicly funded capsule created to conmemorate the 200th anniversary of [[Chile]], was buried in 29 September 2010 at the [[Plaza de Armas (Santiago)|Plaza de Armas]] in [[Santiago]]. It is set to be opened in 18 September 2110.<ref name="Santiago Chile" />
=== France === * [[Normandy American Cemetery and Memorial#Time capsule|Normandy American Cemetery and Memorial]].
=== Iceland === *Erected in 2014, the monument is located in Reykjavik, Iceland, has of three differently shaped 15 feet tall spires, two made of stone and one metal center pillar.<ref>{{Cite web | url=http://www.slate.com/blogs/atlas_obscura/2016/08/29/reykjavik_iceland_s_eve_online_monument_is_an_irl_tribute_to_its_dedicated.html | title=EVE Online Has Honored its Digital Players with an IRL Monument| date=2016-08-29}}</ref>
===India=== * Indian Prime Minister [[Indira Gandhi]] had buried a time capsule outside one of the gate of [[Red Fort]] complex,The Indira Gandhi government named this time capsule "Kalpaatra", Delhi containing post-independence history of India on 15 August 1972 amid political opposition. It was scheduled to be opened after 1000 years. The next [[Janata Party|Janata government]] unearthed it in 1977 but its contents were never made public and were lost.<ref name="Jarvis2002">{{cite book|author=William E. Jarvis|title=Time Capsules: A Cultural History|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=GKuzCgAAQBAJ&pg=PA170|date=11 November 2002|publisher=McFarland|isbn=978-0-7864-1261-7|page=170}}</ref><ref name="Washington Post 1977">{{cite web | title=India's Fleeting Time Capsule | website=Washington Post | date=1977-12-02 | url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/politics/1977/12/02/indias-fleeting-time-capsule/47004ab6-cad9-4db7-92ae-9e95cc0cce8b/ | accessdate=2016-11-19}}</ref><ref name="India Today 31121977 2014">{{cite web | title=Images India | website=India Today 31121977 | date=2014-05-16 | url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/mahatma-gandhi-my-experiments-with-truth-indira-gandhi-emergency-indian-army/1/435817.html | accessdate=2016-11-19}}</ref><ref name="News18 2016">{{cite web | title=A Fort, a Time Capsule, a Secret: The Many Mysteries of Indira Gandhi | website=News18 | date=2016-08-11 | url=http://www.news18.com/news/india/a-fort-a-time-capsule-a-secret-the-many-mysteries-of-indira-gandhi-1280368.html | accessdate=2016-11-19}}</ref> * A time capsule was buried in the presence of the [[President of India]] near the auditorium of [[IIT Kanpur]] on 6 March 2010.<ref>{{cite web|title=President of India buries the Time Capsule |url=http://www.cse.iitk.ac.in/users/gj/new/Events/Presidentvisit.pdf |publisher=IIT Kanpur |date=6 March 2010 |url-status=live |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161119142559/http://www.cse.iitk.ac.in/users/gj/new/Events/Presidentvisit.pdf |archivedate=19 November 2016 }}</ref><ref name="Springer Nature 2010">{{cite journal | title=Tech school buries history for posterity | journal=Nature India | year=2010 | doi=10.1038/nindia.2010.84 }}</ref> * [[Mahatma Mandir]], [[Gandhinagar]] containing the history of Indian state of [[Gujarat]] marking the 50 years of its foundation. Installed in 2010.<ref name="tcie">{{cite news | url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/state-s-time-capsule-to-be-installed-at-mahatma-mandir-today/630351 | title=State's time capsule to be installed at Mahatma Mandir today | work=[[The Indian Express]] | date=7 June 2010 | agency=[[Press Trust of India]] | accessdate=28 March 2013}}</ref><ref name="The Telegraph 1973">{{cite web | title=Blemish buried in buried history | website=The Telegraph | date=15 August 1973 | url=http://www.telegraphindia.com/1110617/jsp/frontpage/story_14124988.jsp | accessdate=19 November 2016}}</ref> * Alexandra Girls' English Institution, a school in [[Fort (Mumbai precinct)|Fort, South Mumbai]] buried a time capsule in 2014, scheduling it to be opened on 1 September 2062, on the bi-centennial anniversary of the school.<ref name="Borwankar 2014">{{cite web | last=Borwankar | first=Vinamrata | title=Back to the past: South Mumbai school to bury a time capsule | website=dna | date=25 March 2014 | url=http://www.dnaindia.com/mumbai/report-back-to-the-past-south-mumbai-school-to-bury-a-time-capsule-1971935 | accessdate=19 November 2016}}</ref> * Under the flag holding of Prime Minister [[Narendra Modi]], a time-capsule was buried in the premises of Lovely Professional University, a University located in Jalandhar, Punjab on the second day of Indian National Congress dated 4 January 2019. The occasion was attended by Nobel laureates, including biochemist Avram Hershko and physicist Duncan Haldane. They lowered a 8x8 time capsule-box made of aluminium and wood with a glass door.10 feet into the ground. A smart phone, '''landline telephone, VCR, stereo player, stop watch, computer parts like hard disk, mouse''', laptop, central processing unit, a motherboard, hard disk with the latest documentaries and movies, a camera, science-text books '''and scientific equipment like rheostat, refrectorscope and double microscope''' are some of the things that will remain buried for 100 years. The area where the capsule has been buried would be cemented and earmarked.
=== Israel === * A time capsule was installed under [[Eretz Israel Museum]] in [[Tel Aviv]] at 30 December 1999. It is scheduled to be opened 100 years later.{{citation needed|date=September 2016}}
=== Kazakhstan === * In [[Aktau]], people of 1967 sent a message showing the chronology of the development of [[Mangyshlak Peninsula]] with the names of the people who helped to build the town in the desert. The letter was put in a metallic cylinder in a triangular marble urn. It opened in November 2017.<ref>[http://ogni.kz/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=5063&Itemid=2 Aktau: Years, people, memories...] Ogni.kz on 13 October 2011</ref>
===Malaysia=== * Rotary Club Time Capsule Monument (GPS: 3.15912, 101.69825) is a commemorative monument along Jalan Sultan Ismail in [[Kuala Lumpur]]. It was originally located at [[Dataran Merdeka]], but was relocated to Jalan Sultan Ismail around 2016. It comprises a stainless steel column topped with a [[Rotary International]] logo. At the base is a black marble-encased pedestal under which a time capsule is buried. The monument was erected to celebrate the presence of Rotary in [[Malaysia]] since 1929. It was officiated by the mayor of Kuala Lumpur, Tan Sri Dato' Kamaruzzaman bin Shariff, on 26 June 2000.
===Norway=== * On 17 September 2017 near the [[Polish Polar Station, Hornsund]] in the Norwegian [[Svalbard]] archipelago, scientific researchers buried a 60-centimeter stainless steel tube containing samples designed to tell finders as long as half a million years into the future, about the current state of knowledge in such areas as geology, biology, and technology.<ref name=20170929Nature>{{cite journal |last1=Schiermeier |first1=Quirin |title=Time capsule buried to preserve science for the ages -- Message in a bottle sums up state of research in 2017 |journal=Nature |url=https://www.nature.com/news/time-capsule-buried-to-preserve-science-for-the-ages-1.22657 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171002161539/https://www.nature.com/news/time-capsule-buried-to-preserve-science-for-the-ages-1.22657 |archivedate=2 October 2017 |date=29 September 2017 |url-status=live |doi=10.1038/nature.2017.22657 }}</ref>
=== Poland === * Prisoners from the [[Auschwitz concentration camp]] concealed bottles containing sketches<ref name=Spiegel20120117>{{cite news |last1=Macbeth |first1=Alex |title='Witness to Extermination': Auschwitz Museum Publishes Prisoner Sketchbook |url=http://www.spiegel.de/international/germany/witness-to-extermination-auschwitz-museum-publishes-prisoner-sketchbook-a-809591.html |publisher=Der Spiegel |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160418031130/http://www.spiegel.de/international/germany/witness-to-extermination-auschwitz-museum-publishes-prisoner-sketchbook-a-809591.html |archivedate=18 April 2016 |date=17 January 2012 |url-status=live|newspaper=Spiegel Online }} Detailed sketches were found in a camp barracks in 1947.</ref> and writings<ref name=BBCNews20090427Novýčas20090430>• {{cite news |title=Builders find Auschwitz message |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/europe/8021845.stm |work=[[BBC News]] |date=27 April 2009 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170307130950/http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/europe/8021845.stm |archivedate=7 March 2017 |url-status=live}} Short prisoner list was found in 2009 in a wall of a bomb shelter that prisoners were forced to build. • {{cite web|title=Záhadný odkaz väzňov v Osvienčime: Autor je už známy! (Mysterious link from prisoners in Auschwitz: The author is already known!) |url=http://www.cas.sk/clanok/115020/zahadny-odkaz-vaznov-v-osviencime-autor-je-uz-znamy/ |publisher=Nový čas |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160729151358/http://www.cas.sk/clanok/115020/zahadny-odkaz-vaznov-v-osviencime-autor-je-uz-znamy/ |archivedate=29 July 2016 |language=Slovak |date=30 April 2009 |url-status=live }}</ref> that were found after World War II. *In 2016, a copper-cylinder time capsule dating to 1934 was found beneath the former Nazi training facility in the [[Ordensburg Krössinsee]] building in [[Złocieniec]], Poland.<ref name=Indep20160916/> The time capsule, which contained photographs, newspapers, coins, and two copies of Hitler's ''[[Mein Kampf]],'' was retrieved by researchers who navigated through thick concrete, German mines, and groundwater.<ref name=Indep20160916>{{cite news |last1=Eleftheriou-Smith |first1=Loulla-Mae |title=Nazi time capsule: Newspapers, photographs and copies of Mein Kampf found 'perfectly preserved' in Poland |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/nazi-time-capsule-poland-mein-kampf-adolf-hitler-discovery-photos-a7315771.html |newspaper=The Independent |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161011212314/http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/nazi-time-capsule-poland-mein-kampf-adolf-hitler-discovery-photos-a7315771.html |archivedate=11 October 2016 |date=16 September 2016 |url-status=live }}</ref>
=== Russia === * In 2012 a time capsule dating from 15 July 1979 was found in Vulkanny ([[Yelizovsky District]], [[Kamchatka peninsula]]) under a statue of Lenin. It contained messages to the "socialist society in 2024."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://facepunch.com/showthread.php?t=1200453 |title=Time capsule found under the statue of Lenin in Moscow |date=2012-07-25 |accessdate=2013-03-26 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6FOyYmsdL?url=http://facepunch.com/showthread.php?t=1200453 |archivedate=2013-03-26 |url-status=dead }}</ref>
=== Singapore === * The oldest known time capsule in Singapore was rediscovered in early 2016, beneath the foundation stone of the [[Cathedral of the Good Shepherd]]. The shoebox-sized time capsule from 18 June 1843 was found to include a prayer booklet and newspapers, and international coins.<ref name=Statesman20160703/> The capsule is thought to have been buried by French Catholic missionary priests and other founding communities of Singapore.<ref name=Statesman20160703>{{cite news |last1=Zaccheus |first1=Melody |title=Message in a bottle |url=http://www.thestatesman.com/news/evolve/message-in-a-bottle/151843.html |newspaper=The Statesman (India) |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160720212207/http://www.thestatesman.com/news/evolve/message-in-a-bottle/151843.html |archivedate=20 July 2016 |date=3 July 2016 |url-status=live}}</ref> * On 1 April 1937 a capsule containing coins and newspapers from the time was buried under the foundation stone of the [[Old Supreme Court Building, Singapore|former Supreme Court building]] with the intention that it be opened in the year 3000. The building now houses the [[National Gallery Singapore]], where the foundation stone can still be seen today. * In 1949 a capsule was buried at [[Anglo-Chinese School (Barker Road)]] containing school magazines, a bible and records of major donors. Thought to be lost, the capsule was rediscovered in 2000 with the help of a former student who had attended the burial ceremony. * A capsule buried in 1950 under the then Royal Island Club (now the Singapore Island Country Club) was thought to be lost but later found by construction workers in 2010. It contained photographs and newspapers. * In 1970, one of Singapore's founding leaders, [[Goh Keng Swee|Dr Goh Keng Swee]] laid a [[copper]] cylinder containing newspapers and Singapore bank notes from the era, somewhere in the [[Former National Stadium, Singapore|former National Stadium]]. Unfortunately the location has been lost and metal detectors have failed to find it despite a $50,000 reward on offer.<ref name=SGTimeCapsules>{{cite news |title=6 interesting facts about SG50 and other time capsules unearthed |url=http://www.straitstimes.com/singapore/sg50-time-capsule-sealed-6-interesting-facts-about-time-capsules-unearthed |newspaper=Straits Times|date=2016-03-20 }}</ref> * Since 1973, [[Science Centre Singapore]] has been depositing gadgets and examples of significant technologies in a time capsule inaugurated by then Science and Technology Minister [[Toh Chin Chye|Dr Toh Chin Chye]]. The first 112 items deposited included a black and white television receiver, a camera and samples of pig feed. After additional deposits were made in 1983, 2001 and 2013 the original capsule was replaced with a larger [[stainless steel]] container that now holds over 800 items in an atmosphere of inert [[nitrogen]] gas in the hope that this will better preserve the artefacts inside.<ref name=SGTimeCapsules/> * The [[Jurong Town Corporation]] buried a time capsule under [[Jurong Town Hall]] in 1974. When opened in 2001, the capsule was found to contain reports, articles and photographs illustrating the industrialisation of [[Jurong]]. * In 1975, part of Singapore's contribution to an International Ocean Exposition held in [[Okinawa]], [[Japan]] entitled ''The Sea We Would Like to See'' was a research project using floating time capsules. The previous year, 50 small round capsules were released from [[Raffles Lighthouse]] as part of a global fleet of 2,800 to measure oceanic tides and currents. Each capsule contained information about the Exposition, a goodwill message from a Japanese child and a voucher for a [[Citizen Watch|Citizen]] ''Blackie'' watch to incentivise finders to fill in a post card with details of where the capsule were found. 24 of the capsules released in Singapore were later recovered. * 1990 saw the unexpected unearthing of a time capsule from the 1950s by contractors working at the demolished American Insurance building in Robinson Road. Buried on 26 April 1956, the copper canister contained English and Chinese newspapers, a financial report, photographs, posters and an insurance agent's manual.<ref name=SGTimeCapsules/> * In 2015, a time capsule buried to celebrate Singapore's 25th year of independence was dug up and replaced with one celebrating 50 years as a sovereign nation. The original canister held 88 "symbols of progress" including a [[video tape]] of the 1966 [[National Day Parade|National Day (Singapore)]], water from the [[Singapore River]] and the first [[Kebaya|sarong kebaya]] uniforms designed by [[Pierre Balmain]] for [[Singapore Airlines]] in 1968. The replacement capsule, made from [[stainless steel]], was buried by then Deputy Prime Minister [[Ong Teng Cheong]] outside Empress Place.<ref name=SGTimeCapsules/> * On 31 August 2005, [[Singapore Polytechnic]] buried a time capsule in order to conclude year-long celebrations of its [[50th anniversary]] of its founding in 1954.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.sp.edu.sg/wps/portal/vp-spws/spws.org.abtsp.story.sptimeline|title=SP Timeline - Singapore Polytechnic|last=|first=|date=29 August 2017|website=Singapore Polytechnic|access-date=}}</ref> Located near its main library, it is scheduled to be re-opened in 2029 for its 75th anniversary.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=https://myspmemories.sp.edu.sg/TimeLine/50th-Anniversary-Time-Capsule?Id=15#1|title=The Time Capsule Ceremony|last=|first=|date=29 August 2017|website=My SP Memories|access-date=}}</ref> Items in the time capsule included staff and student admission cards, a CD of 2004's graduation ceremony and a bottle of locally brewed red wine.
=== Spain === * An 1834 time capsule was discovered in 2009 under a statue of [[Miguel de Cervantes]] in Madrid. It contains a guide and four volumes of the 1819 edition of ''[[Don Quixote]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://video.es.msn.com/watch/video/abierta-la-capsula-del-tiempo/6vm3hvzq?from=truveo |title=Abierta la cápsula del tiempo en MSN Vídeo |publisher=Video.es.msn.com |date= |accessdate=2012-07-15}}</ref> * A time capsule was buried in [[Motril]], [[Granada]]. It will be opened on 22 July 2023 to celebrate the 150th anniversary of the cantonal movement.<ref>{{cite web|author=Publicado por MD |url=http://motrildigital.blogspot.com/2008/07/motril-albergar-la-segunda-cpsula-del.html |title=motril digital: Motril albergará la segunda cápsula del tiempo existente en España |publisher=Motrildigital.blogspot.com |date= 2008-08-07|accessdate=2012-07-15}}</ref> * A 1777 time capsule was discovered within a religious statue in Sotillo de la Ribera (Burgos). It contained two handwritten pages describing details of the political, religious, and economic situation of the region at the time.<ref>{{cite web|author=Diario ABC |url=http://www.abc.es/espana/castilla-leon/abci-hallan-capsula-tiempo-oculta-talla-siglo-xviii-201711272030_noticia.html?#ns_campaign=mod-outbrain&ns_mchannel=abc.es&ns_source=organico&ns_linkname=mobile&ns_fee=MB_21|title=Hallan una cápsula del tiempo oculta en una talla del siglo XVIII |date= 2017-11-27|accessdate=2017-11-27}}</ref>
=== United Kingdom === * [[Kingussie]], Scotland: in August 2015 workers discovered a metal box containing a newspaper from 29 September 1894, a paper scroll and a bottle believed to contain whisky.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-scotland-highlands-islands-34054847|title=121-year-old time capsule found at bridge near Kingussie|date=26 August 2015|publisher=[[BBC]]|accessdate=26 August 2015}}</ref> * [[Macclesfield]], Cheshire: in April 2010 an urn container from 1876 was found under a granite slab in the United Reformed Church. The content (newspapers and photographs) was perfectly preserved.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-1269668/Time-capsule-dating-1876-discovered-buried-underneath-church-memorial.html |title=Time capsule dating back to 1876 discovered buried underneath church memorial |date=2010-04-29 |accessdate=2013-03-26 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6FP1FDt83?url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-1269668/Time-capsule-dating-1876-discovered-buried-underneath-church-memorial.html |archivedate=2013-03-26 |url-status=dead }}</ref> * [[Newton Aycliffe]], [[County Durham]], England: On 21 March 2017 a time capsule bearing the name of its creator, James D Robinson, was 'sealed' at an informal gathering in a local church hall. It was subsequently transferred to the nearby Durham County Record Office, at County Hall, in the City of Durham, where it will reside in their archive facility for the next 300 years. The capsule contains an eclectic mix of texts and images along with a number of artefacts, and is scheduled to be opened on 21 March 2317. * The children's television show [[Blue Peter]] have buried several time capsules during the programme's run. Ones buried in London in 1971 and 1984 were opened in January 2000. A third was then buried to be opened in 2029, which has since been relocated to [[Salford, Greater Manchester|Salford]], Greater Manchester. One was also placed under the [[Millennium Dome]] in London in 1998, to be opened in 2050,<ref>{{cite book|title=The Book Of Lists, London|author=Rennison, Nick|publisher=Canongate|year=2006|page=277}}</ref> but was accidentally unearthed and damaged during construction work in 2017. It will be reburied once it has been repaired.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-38838033|title=Blue Peter time capsule dug up 33 years early|date=2017-02-02|accessdate=2017-02-02}}</ref>{{Update inline|date=January 2019}} * [[Southampton]], Hampshire: a 1935 message in a lemonade bottle, correctly portending difficult times lying ahead, was found in 2016 by masons restoring damaged Portland stone at [[Southampton Guildhall]].<ref name=ITV20160209>{{cite web |title='Message in a bottle' discovered in Southampton |url=http://www.itv.com/news/meridian/2016-02-09/message-in-a-bottle-discovered-in-southampton/ |publisher=ITV |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160210164227/http://www.itv.com/news/meridian/2016-02-09/message-in-a-bottle-discovered-in-southampton/ |archivedate=10 February 2016 |date=9 February 2016 |url-status=live }}</ref> *Millennium Vault, Europe's largest time capsule was built in 2000 in [[Guildford|Guildford, Surrey]]. The capsule which contains lots of mementos is set to be opened in one-thousand years in 3000.
=== United States === * Waynesboro, Virginia. Time capsule for [https://www.fishburne.org/ Fishburne Military School] to be opened in 2179, the school's 300th anniversary. * Richmond, Indiana. Time capsule placed in cornerstone of YMCA in 1955.{{citation needed|date=September 2016}} * On 15 June 1957, as part of the celebration of the 50th anniversary of [[Oklahoma]] statehood, a 1957 [[Plymouth Belvedere]] car was sealed in an underground vault in [[Tulsa]], to be unearthed 50 years later on 14 June 2007 during Oklahoma's centennial celebration. Several items were left in the car's trunk and glove compartment, such as a 5 US gallon can of gasoline intended to start the car, should gasoline not be the fuel of choice for motor vehicles in 2007. A contest also took place, in which the contestant who came the closest to guessing the city population in 2007, would then be awarded the car and $100 in a savings account. * Time Capsule in ghost town, [[Centralia, Pennsylvania|Centralia]], [[Pennsylvania (U.S. state)|Pennsylvania]] was to be opened in 2016 but was opened in 2014 instead. Within the time capsule was about two feet of water destroying most paper artifacts in the capsule. A miner's helmet and a pair of bloomers signed by the men living in the city at the time are among artifacts that remained.<ref>{{cite web|title=Centralia PA Time Capsule opened early|url=http://www.centraliapa.org/centralia-pennsylvania-time-capsule-opened-early-2014/|website=www.centraliapa.org|accessdate=2016-01-28|date=2014-10-05}}</ref><ref>{{cite magazine|url=http://www.smithsonianmag.com/science-nature/fire-in-the-hole-77895126/|title=Fire in the Hole|last1=Krajick|first1=Krajick|magazine=Smithsonian Magazine|issue=May 2005|accessdate=20 July 2017}}</ref> * [[Crypt of Civilization]] in [[Atlanta]], [[Georgia (U.S. state)|Georgia]]<ref name="oglethorpe.edu">[http://www.oglethorpe.edu/about_us/crypt_of_civilization/]{{dead link|date=June 2019}}</ref> * [[Westinghouse Time Capsules]] in [[New York City]]<ref name="Manufacturing Company 1939">Westinghouse Electric and Manufacturing Company, The Story of Westinghouse Time Capsule of cupaloy (1939)</ref> * [[Don Harrington Discovery Center|Helium Centennial Time Columns Monument]] in [[Amarillo, Texas|Amarillo]], Texas<ref name=Helium1968/> * Disneyland 40th Anniversary Time Capsule in [[Anaheim]], [[California (U.S. state)|California]]; to open in July 2035{{citation needed|date=September 2016}} * [[Green-Wood Cemetery]], Brooklyn, NY: a time capsule placed in a cornerstone in 1954 was found in January 2013<ref name="Time Capsule Discovered">{{cite web|url=http://www.green-wood.com/2013/time-capsule-discovered/ |title=Time Capsule Discovered |date=2013-01-22 |accessdate=2013-03-26 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6FP0pwzma?url=http://www.green-wood.com/2013/time-capsule-discovered/ |archivedate=2013-03-26 |url-status=dead }}</ref> * [[Salt Lake City]], 78 S. Main & 100 South: In 2012, a time capsule from Nov. 25, 1959 containing predictions for the year 2000 was found in the outside wall of the former First Federal Savings Bank<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.deseretnews.com/article/865551475/Forgotten-time-capsule-discovered.html |title=Forgotten time capsule discovered |date=2012-03-05 |accessdate=2013-03-26 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6FOztRVQS?url=http://www.deseretnews.com/article/865551475/Forgotten-time-capsule-discovered.html |archivedate=2013-03-26 |url-status=dead }}</ref> * [[Fort Collins, Colorado|Fort Collins]], Colorado: In January 2013, a time capsule dated 6 June 1907 was found in a cornerstone of the building at 140 Oak Street<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.coloradoan.com/article/20130111/NEWS01/301110044/Time-capsule-provides-glimpse-into-Fort-Collins-past?nclick_check=1 |title=Time capsule provides glimpse into Fort Collins' past |date=2010-04-29 |accessdate=2013-01-13 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6FP1icvJe?url=http://www.coloradoan.com/needlogin?type%3Dlogin%26redirecturl%3Dhttp://www.coloradoan.com/article/20130111/NEWS01/301110044/Time-capsule-provides-glimpse-into-Fort-Collins-past?nclick_check%3D1 |archivedate=2013-03-26 |url-status=dead }}</ref> * Merrick Park Time Capsule in [[Coral Gables, Florida|Coral Gables]], Florida{{citation needed|date=September 2016}} * A 100-year-old time capsule in the First Lutheran Church of Oklahoma City opened on 23 April 2013 * [[Detroit Century Box]] in [[Detroit]], Michigan, containing 56 letters from prominent citizens, sealed at midnight on 31 December 1900 and opened on 31 December 2000<ref>Andrea Cecil, [http://www.mlive.com/living/kalamazoo/index.ssf/2008/12/oncall_request_time_capsule.html "100-year-old time capsule opened in Detroit"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130619062052/http://www.mlive.com/living/kalamazoo/index.ssf/2008/12/oncall_request_time_capsule.html |date=2013-06-19 }} Republished from the ''[[Kalamazoo Gazette]]'' (2 January 2001). Retrieved 13 August 2013</ref><ref>[http://detroithistorical.wordpress.com/2012/10/12/future-friday-century-box-prophecies/ "Future Friday: Century Box Prophecies"] Detroit Historical Society. Retrieved 13 August 2013</ref> * In 1992, a time capsule was buried at [[Nickelodeon Studios]] containing items that kids considered important at that time. It was moved to the [[Nickelodeon Suites Resort Orlando]] in 2005 and later to the [[Nickelodeon Animation Studio]] in 2016, and will be opened in 2042.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://mentalfloss.com/article/31016/every-item-inside-time-capsule-nickelodeon-buried-1992|title=Every Item in Nickelodeon's 1992 Time Capsule|author=|date=25 June 2012|website=mentalfloss.com}}</ref> * Time capsule in [[Coeur d'Alene, Idaho|Coeur d'Alene]], Idaho.{{citation needed|date=September 2016}} * Time capsule encased in cement at the entrance of the Miami Dade County Courthouse, 73 W. Flagler, St., Miami, Florida. To be opened on Sept. 17, 2087.{{citation needed|date=September 2016}} * The [[Samuel Adams and Paul Revere Time Capsule]] was found under the Golden Dome of the Massachusetts State House in December 2014. It is believed to have been buried in 1795 by then-Governor Samuel Adams and Paul Revere, and contained newspapers, a commonwealth seal, colony records, coins, a silver plate, and copper medal. It was uncovered, then added to and replaced, in 1855. Being 219 years old, it is the oldest time capsule to be discovered in the United States.<ref name=CNN20150107>{{cite web|last1=Shoichet |first1=Catherine E. |title=1795 time capsule opened, centuries after Revere and Adams buried it |url=http://www.cnn.com/2015/01/06/us/feat-paul-revere-sam-adams-boston-time-capsule/index.html |publisher=CNN |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160310223909/http://www.cnn.com/2015/01/06/us/feat-paul-revere-sam-adams-boston-time-capsule/index.html |archivedate=10 March 2016 |date=7 January 2015 |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.businessinsider.com/boston-unearthing-paul-revere-time-capsule-from-1795-2014-12|title=Boston Is Digging Up What Could Be The Oldest Unopened Time Capsule Ever|author=|date=|website=businessinsider.com}}</ref> * A [https://news.mit.edu/2015/mitnano-time-capsule-1118|glass time capsule buried at MIT in 1957] was accidentally unearthed during construction in 2015. Made to be opened in 2957, [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t0MVqBbOIss|its condition is checked] and then it's put aside for reburial. * On 1 September 1975, a time capsule was buried at the intersection of 7th and Main in [[Louisville, Kentucky|Louisville]], Kentucky to be opened in 100 years.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://unusualkentucky.blogspot.com/2010/03/louisville-bicentennial-time-capsule.html|title=Unusual Kentucky: Louisville Bicentennial Time Capsule|last=Jsh|date=12 March 2010|website=unusualkentucky.blogspot.com}}</ref> * A time capsule was buried in 1984 by patrons of the nightclub [[Danceteria]]. Intended to be opened in the year 6984, it was instead uncovered by construction workers in 2017.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cbc.ca/radio/asithappens/as-it-happens-thursday-edition-1.4192830/the-sparkling-and-wonderful-story-behind-the-time-capsule-that-caused-a-nyc-bomb-scare-1.4192834|title=The 'sparkling and wonderful' story behind the time capsule that caused a NYC bomb scare|publisher=[[As It Happens]]|date= 6 July 2017|accessdate=20 July 2017}}</ref> * In 1975, a time capsule with contents of that year, was buried in front of Brooks Academy in [[Harwich, Massachusetts|Harwich]], Massachusetts. The time capsule is due to be opened 100 years from the burial date, in the capsule's centennial year of 2075.
[[File:216932main time cap 226(1).gif|thumb|Time capsule at NASA Glenn Research Center]]
* On 23 January 1991 a time capsule was placed in a sculpture at [[NASA Glenn Research Center|NASA Lewis (now Glenn) Research Center]], celebrating the 50th anniversary of the Center's groundbreaking. The capsule is scheduled to be opened on 23 January 2041.<ref>{{cite web|title=Glenn's 50th Anniversary Time Capsule|url=https://www.nasa.gov/centers/glenn/about/history/timecpsl.html|website=National Aeronautics and Space Administration|publisher=NASA|accessdate=26 July 2017}}</ref> * On 14 January 2000, Livermore California buried two time capsules. Information at http://www.lhg.org/time. One capsule may have been reburied from a previous burial. * Time capsule at St. Joseph School in [[Mendham, NJ]].{{citation needed|date=September 2016}} * The largest time capsule in the world is located in Seward, Nebraska, containing over 5,000 items, one of which is a Chevy Vega. It opens in July 2025.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.roadsideamerica.com/story/15985|title=World's Largest Time Capsule, Seward, Nebraska|website=RoadsideAmerica.com|language=en|access-date=2017-07-01}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.ketv.com/article/seward-time-capsule-nears-2025-opening/22148018|title=Seward time capsule nears 2025 opening|last=Ozaki|first=Andrew|date=2018-07-16|work=KETV|access-date=2018-08-30|language=en}}</ref> * On 1 August 1969 Wayne Centennial Time Capsule was placed in Wayne, MI and is due to be opened on 1 August 2069. [http://www.waymarking.com/waymarks/WM2J56_Wayne_Centennial_Time_Capsule_Wayne_Michigan] * On 3 September 2013 [[Perry Hall High School]] buried a time capsule on the occasion of the school's 50th anniversary. It is to be opened on 3 September 2063.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://patch.com/maryland/perryhall/perry-hall-time-capsuleare-you-inside|title=Perry Hall Time Capsule—Are You Inside?, Perry Hall, Maryland|language=en|date= 28 August 2013|access-date=2018-07-08}}</ref> * In August 2018 [http://www.seapinesmontessori.com Sea Pines Montessori Academy] buried a time capsule on the occasion of the school's 50th anniversary. It is to be buried in [http://www.hiltonhead-sc.com/harbour-town.html Harbour Town] on Hilton Head Island, South Carolina and opened in August 2068. *[[Boulder, Colorado|Boulder]], Colorado: The courthouse plaza at [[Pearl Street Mall]] has two time capsules: one to be opened in 2075, the other in 2096.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.openstreetmap.org/search?query=time%20capsule%2C%2080306|title=OpenStreetMap search|website=OpenStreetMap|language=en-US|access-date=2018-08-30}}</ref> *[[Reno, Nevada]]: A time capsule was placed in cornerstone at the Reno Masonic Lodge in October 1872. It was opened on April 16, 2019. It contained more than 40 items, including a harmonica, a corkscrew, silver dollars minted in [[Carson City]] and [[San Francisco]], a piece of wood from [[Sutter's Mill]], and copies of several newspapers, including the [[Reno Gazette-Journal|Nevada State Journal]], the [[Nevada Appeal]], and the [[Territorial Enterprise]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://apnews.com/a9b3b378e45d4479a63c633f764a9c7c|title=Reno's 1872 time capsule includes California Gold Rush lore|last=Sonner|first=Scott|date=2019-04-17|website=AP NEWS|access-date=2019-06-23}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.kolotv.com/content/news/Masonic_Lodge_time_capsule_opening-508499281.html|title=1872 time capsule from Masonic Lodge opened in Reno|last=Staff|website=www.kolotv.com|language=english|access-date=2019-06-23}}</ref>
== In space == * [[Apollo 11 goodwill messages]], on the [[Moon]] * [[Immortality Drive]], in the [[International Space Station]] * [[Rosetta disk]] prototype, on the [[Rosetta (spacecraft)#Naming|Rosetta]] space probe * Plaque on [[LAGEOS#Time capsule|LAGEOS-1]] * [[Arch Mission]] 1.2 on the Tesla Roadster in solar orbit and in the [[SpaceIL#Beresheet lander|Beresheet]] moon lander.
== In cinema == * ''[[100 Years (film)|100 Years]]'', a film shot and produced in 2015 with release scheduled for 18 November 2115. It is being kept in a high-tech safe behind bulletproof glass that will open automatically on the film's premiere.
== In internet == * [[Yahoo Time Capsule]], open as Yahoo.com 20th anniversary
== Projected == * [[KEO]] * [[Lansing Time Capsule]]
